message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.LG 

This paper presents a method for generating a video of a talking face using still images and audio speech, which involves computer vision (CV) and multimedia (MM) techniques. The proposed model is an encoder-decoder CNN, which is a common architecture used in CV and MM tasks. The model is trained on unlabelled videos, which suggests unsupervised learning (SD) techniques may have been used. The paper also mentions re-dubbing videos, which involves natural language processing (CL) techniques. Finally, the real-time aspect of the method suggests that it may involve machine learning (LG) techniques for efficient processing.
